result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(Case called at 2:25 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Jay J. Conklin appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Jay J. Conklin.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant enters Not Guilty pleas on all counts. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Court receives Not Guilty pleas and orders 20 days for motions. Court indicates a speedy trial demand is on file. Defense requests withdrawal of speedy trial demand. However State makes request for prompt disposition under victims rights statute. Court finds the Defendant request for speedy trial demand under 971(11) is withdrawn. State indicates there are motions forthcoming. Defense requests separate motion hearing date. 
Final Status Conference: 11/14/2022 at 10:30 AM (already scheduled). 3 Day Jury Trial: 12/12/2022 through 12/14/2022 (already scheduled).  
Motion Hearing to be scheduled with Branch 2 Judicial Assistant once motion(s) are filed.
Arraignment on October 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Same as Complaint.

3:02 PM Defendant Jay J. Conklin appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Knaak in court for Jay J. Conklin.  Attorney Zebulon Patek in court for Jay J. Conklin.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives the right to appear in person freely and voluntarily with the advice of counsel.

State calls Detective Zach Burnett, ECPD to the stand; sworn and testifies. Witness identifies defendant and the record will so reflect. Cross examination by Defense. Witness steps down. 

State requests bind over. Defense does not have argument.

Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over for further proceedings.

2:25 PM Defendant Jay J. Conklin appeared by video, in custody from the Stanley Correctional Institute without counsel.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. This is the date and time set for a Preliminary Hearing. There will not be a hearing today. The defendant would like to retain counsel. The defendant is not willing to waive time limits for a preliminary hearing. Court finds good cause to extend the time limits for a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

(11:09 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jay J. Conklin appeared by video, in custody in the Stanley Correctional Institution without counsel.
Defendant advises hasn't received a copy of the criminal complaint.
State advises faxed a copy to Stanley Correctional this morning and will be sure they have received it for tomorrow.
Court adjourns the initial appearance for tomorrow to allow the defendant an opportunity to receive and review the complaint.
Court reviews the complaint and finds probable cause to extend the hearing until tomorrow.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
